uk.ac.ebi.miriam.ws
Class MiriamProvider

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ebi.miriam.ws.MiriamProvider
public class MiriamProvider
extends Object

MIRIAM web services provider (server part)

Part of the MIRIAM Web Services package (uk.ac.ebi.miriam.ws)

Uses (with many thanks to these projects):

  • logging, with Log4J
  • connection pool, with DBCP

And:

  • Apache Tomcat
  • Apache Axis

Copyright:
EMBL-EBI, Computational Neurobiology Group

Version:
20060703
Author:
Camille Laibe

Method Detail

getDataTypeURN

public String getDataTypeURN(String name)
Retrieves the unique URN of a data-type (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - name primary name (or synonym) of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt", "GO")
Returns:
unique (official) URN of the resource

getDataTypeURNs

public String[] getDataTypeURNs(String name)
Retrieves the unique (official) URN of the resource (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org") and all the deprecated ones.

Parameters:
name - name or synonym of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URN and all the deprecated ones

getDataTypeURL

public String getDataTypeURL(String name)
Retrieves unique (official) URL (not a physical URL but a URI) of the resource (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/").

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URL of the resource

getDataTypeURLs

public String[] getDataTypeURLs(String name)
Retrieves the unique (official) URL (not a physical URL but a URI) of the resource (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/") and all the deprecated ones.

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URL of the resource and all the deprecated ones

getDataTypeURI

public String getDataTypeURI(String name,
                             String type)
Retrieves the unique (official) URL or URN of the resource (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/", "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - name of the data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
type - type of the URI the user wants to recover ('URN' or 'URL')
Returns:
unique URL or URN of the resource

getURN

public String getURN(String name,
                     String id)
Retrieves the unique URN of the resource (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org:P62158").

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
unique URN of the resource

getURL

public String getURL(String name,
                     String id)
Retrieves unique URN of the resource (example: "http://www.geneontology.org/#GO:0045202").

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
unique URN of the resource

getURI

public String getURI(String name,
                     String id,
                     String type)
Retrieves the unique URI (URL or URN) of the resource (example: "http://www.geneontology.org/#GO:0045202", "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
type - type of the URI the user wants to recover ('URN' or 'URL')
Returns:
unique URI of the resource

getDataTypeDef

public String getDataTypeDef(String nickname)
Retrieves the definition of the data-type.

Parameters:
nickname - name or URI (URN or URL) of a data-type
Returns:
definition of the data-type

getDataEntries

public String[] getDataEntries(String nickname,
                               String id)
Retrieves the physical locationS (URLs) of web pageS about the element.

Parameters:
nickname - name (can be a synonym) or URN or URL of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
physical locationS of web pageS about the element

getDataResources

public String[] getDataResources(String nickname)
Retrieves all the physical locations (URLs) of the services providing the resource (web page).

Parameters:
nickname - name (can be a synonym) or URL or URN of a data-type name (or synonym) or URI (URL or URN)
Returns:
array of strings containing all the physical locations

isDeprecated

public String isDeprecated(String uri)
To know if a URI is deprecated.

Parameters:
uri - (URN or URL) of a data-type
Returns:
answer ("true" or "false") to the question: is this URI deprecated?

getOfficialURI

public String getOfficialURI(String uri)
Retrieves the offical URI (URN if the user entered a URN, URL if not) corresponding to the deprecated one.

Parameters:
uri - deprecated URI (URN or URL) of a data-type
Returns:
the offical URI corresponding to the deprecated one

getDataTypePattern

public String getDataTypePattern(String nickname)
Retrieves the pattern (regular expression) of the data-type

Parameters:
nickname - data-type name (or synonym) or URI (URL or URN)
Returns:
pattern of the data-type

getDataTypeSynonyms

public String[] getDataTypeSynonyms(String name)
Retrieves all the synonym names of the data-type, with the original name

Parameters:
name - or synonym of a data-type
Returns:
all the synonym names of the data-type

getName

public String getName(String uri)
Retrieves the common name of a data-type

Parameters:
uri - URI (URL or URN) of a data-type
Returns:
the common name of the data-type

getNames

public String[] getNames(String uri)
Retrieves all the names (with synonyms) of a data-type

Parameters:
uri - URI (URL or URN) of a data-type
Returns:
the common name of the data-type and all the synonyms
